meanings.definition: The 11th letter of the Greek alphabet.
meanings.sent1: In the Greek alphabet, lambda comes after kappa.
meanings.sent2: I learned about lambda while studying the Greek alphabet.
meanings.sent3: Why did the lambda go to the toga party? To meet other Greek letters!
meanings.sent4: The lambda of the alphabet dance group stood out with its unique shape.
meanings.sent5: The lambda symbol looks like a fancy 'V'.

meanings.definition: A unit of measure for wavelength in physics.
meanings.sent1: The scientist measured the wavelength using lambda.
meanings.sent2: Lambda is an important concept in physics.
meanings.sent3: Why did the photon break up with the lambda? They had no wavelength in common!
meanings.sent4: The lambda of light stretched across the spectrum like a colorful rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The lambda of the wave determined its color and frequency.

meanings.definition: A symbol used in mathematics to represent a constant.
meanings.sent1: In the equation, lambda represents a fixed value.
meanings.sent2: Mathematicians often use lambda as a constant.
meanings.sent3: Why did the variable break up with lambda? It wanted more variability!
meanings.sent4: The lambda in the formula acted like a steadfast guardian, unchanging and reliable.
meanings.sent5: The value of lambda remained constant throughout the mathematical calculation.
